XRP ของ Ripple ร่วงลง 13% ต่อวัน Bitcoin (BTC) ต่ำกว่า $70K: Market Watch

Ripple’s XRP Dumps by 13% Daily, Bitcoin (BTC) Slipped Below $70K: Market Watch

1d ago//Jordan Lyanchev
bitcoinaltcoins
AI

Summary

TH

ตลาด Cryptocurrency กำลังเผชิญกับการถีบต่ำลงอย่างหนัก โดย Bitcoin (BTC) ร่วงลงไปต่ำกว่า $70,000 หลังจากถูกตีตรวนอย่างรุนแรงจากระดับ $90,000 การปรับตัวลงครั้งนี้ทำให้ Bitcoin หมดกำไรที่เกิดขึ้นหลังการเลือกตั้งของ Trump ส่งผลให้ราคาลดลง 7% ในรายวันและ 20% ในรอบสัปดาห์ พร้อมกับมูลค่าตลาดตกลงเหลือ $1.410 ล้านล้านดอลลาร์ ตลาด Altcoin ก็ได้รับผลกระทบอย่างมากเช่นกัน นำโดย XRP ซึ่งเป็นเหรียญที่ปรับตัวลงหนักที่สุดในกลุ่ม 100 อันดับแรกด้วยการดิ่งลง 13% ไปอยู่ต่ำกว่า $1.40 สินทรัพย์หลักอย่าง Ethereum, BNB และ Solana ต่างก็อยู่ในภาวะขาลงเช่นกัน ทำให้มูลค่าตลาดรวมของ Cryptocurrency ตกลงเหลือต่ำกว่า $2.5 ล้านล้านดอลลาร์

EN

The cryptocurrency market is facing a severe downturn, with Bitcoin (BTC) slipping below $70,000 after being violently rejected from the $90,000 level. This decline has erased all gains made following Trump’s reelection, resulting in a 7% daily drop and a 20% loss over the past week, pushing BTC's market cap down to $1.410 trillion. The altcoin market is suffering heavy losses, led by XRP, which is the worst performer among the top 100 coins with a 13% daily drop to under $1.40. Major assets like Ethereum, BNB, and Solana are also trading deep in the red, contributing to a total crypto market cap that has plummeted below $2.5 trillion.

Key Points

  • Bitcoin (BTC) fell below $70,000, erasing post-election gains and dropping 20% weekly.
  • XRP led the altcoin losses with a 13% daily drop, falling below $1.40.
  • Total crypto market cap dropped below $2.5 trillion as major altcoins like ETH and BNB bled out.

Article

XRP is today's most substantial loser from the largest 100 alts, dumping below $1.40. ZEC and MORPHO follow suit. Bitcoin’s poor price performance continues in full force as the asset erased all gains seen after Trump’s reelection by slipping below $70,000 earlier today. Most altcoins have bled out heavily as well, and it’s not just XRP. ETH, BNB, SOL, DOGE, ADA, and many more have posted massive declines. BTC Dipped Beneath $70K It’s almost hard to believe that just over a week ago, last Wednesday, bitcoin traded at $90,000. The developments since then have been nothing short of pure bear domination. While the reasons are still debated, the fact is that BTC was violently rejected at that point and driven south hard. At first, it fell to $81,000 last Thursday, rebounded to $84,000 on Friday, and plummeted again to under $75,000 on Saturday. After an unsuccessful relief rally to $79,000, the bears were back in control and drove it to $73,000 on Tuesday. The dead-cat bounce pattern repeated and bitcoin continued to lose value in the past 12 hours or so. Moreover, it dumped below $70,000 earlier today for the first time since just after the US elections in 2024. It has now bounced to slightly above $70,000, but it’s still 7% down daily and 20% in the red weekly. Its market cap has plummeted to $1.410 trillion on CG, while its dominance over the alts struggles at 57%. BTCUSD Feb 5. Source TradingView Alts Keep Bleeding The altcoins’ charts are just as painful, even more on some occasions. ETH is down by 6% as well as even Vitalik Buterin has started to dispose of his tokens. BNB has dumped below $700, while XRP has become today’s poorest performers with a double-digit drop to under $1.38. This is its lowest price tag in well over a year. SOL, ADA< DOGE, XMR, LINK, and many others are deep in the red. HYPE continues to be among the few exceptions, gaining almost 5% to $34. The total crypto market cap has erased another $170 billion and is below $2.5 trillion on CG now. Cryptocurrency Market Overview Feb 5.
